comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: President Wilson's daughter, Jessie Woodrow Wilson Sayre, with her husband Francis Bowes Sayre, and their son, Frances B. Sayre Jr. Their wikipedia entries: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessie_Woodrow_Wilson_Sayre en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Bowes_Sayre,_Sr. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Bowes_Sayre,_Jr. That little baby, born in the White House, would grow up to march with Martin Luther King Jr. from Selma to Montgomery.

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: That is simply amazing.  Thanks for that info penny.  Bits like that are what make me love looking at these pictures.

comment._content: Bachrach Photography still exists. www.bachrachinc.com/ See also voices.washingtonpost.com/postmortem/2010/03/bachrach-pho...

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Penny -- The Wikipedia links for Frances Bowes Sayre, Senior and Junior, are correctly pasted in, but the trailing period isn't linked (at least on Flickr), so it goes to an 'error' page. Adding an underscore to the end (after the period) will fix this, as shown below. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Bowes_Sayre,_Jr._ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Bowes_Sayre,_Sr._ I think this is a URL coding error at Wikipedia, but I am not an "html guy" -- I don't know much about it... I just play around with stuff until it works ;)
